message.content:
cs.RO, cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SY. 

The paper presents an approach for building an active agent that learns to segment its visual observations into individual objects by interacting with its environment in a completely self-supervised manner. This involves using a segmentation model to infer pixels that constitute objects and refining the segmentation model by interacting with these pixels. The paper also proposes a robust set loss to deal with noisy training signal for segmenting objects obtained by self-supervised interactions. The approach is tested on a downstream vision-based control task of rearranging multiple objects into target configurations from visual inputs alone. Based on these aspects, the most likely sub-categories are cs.RO (Robotics), cs.CV (Computer Vision), and cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also involves aspects of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.SY (Systems and Control), which are less likely but still relevant sub-categories.
